title: concatenate_h5mu
description: Concatenates several uni-modal samples in .h5mu files into a single file.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

input.description: Type: List of `file`, required, example: `sample_paths`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Paths to the different samples to be concatenated
input.help_text: Type: List of `file`, required, example: `sample_paths`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Paths to the different samples to be concatenated.

input_id.description: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Names of the different samples that have to be concatenated
input_id.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Names of the different samples that have to be concatenated.  Must be specified when using '--mode move'.
In this case, the ids will be used for the columns names of the dataframes registring the conflicts.
If specified, must be of same length as `--input`.

output_compression.description: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. The compression format to be used on the output h5mu object
output_compression.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. The compression format to be used on the output h5mu object.

obs_sample_name.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `sample_id`. Name of the .obs key under which to add the sample names.

other_axis_mode.description: Type: `string`, default: `move`, choices: ``same`, `unique`, `first`, `only`, `concat`, `move``. How to handle the merging of other axis (var, obs,
other_axis_mode.help_text:
Type: `string`, default: `move`, choices: ``same`, `unique`, `first`, `only`, `concat`, `move``. How to handle the merging of other axis (var, obs, ...).

  - None: keep no data
  - same: only keep elements of the matrices which are the same in each of the samples
  - unique: only keep elements for which there is only 1 possible value (1 value that can occur in multiple samples)
  - first: keep the annotation from the first sample
  - only: keep elements that show up in only one of the objects (1 unique element in only 1 sample)
  - move: identical to 'same', but moving the conflicting values to .varm or .obsm

uns_merge_mode.description: Type: `string`, default: `make_unique`, choices: ``same`, `unique`, `first`, `only`, `make_unique``. How to handle the merging of
uns_merge_mode.help_text:
Type: `string`, default: `make_unique`, choices: ``same`, `unique`, `first`, `only`, `make_unique``. How to handle the merging of .uns across modalities
  - None: keep no data
  - same: only keep elements of the matrices which are the same in each of the samples
  - unique: only keep elements for which there is only 1 possible value (1 value that can occur in multiple samples)
  - first: keep the annotation from the first sample
  - only: keep elements that show up in only one of the objects (1 unique element in only 1 sample)
  - make_unique: identical to 'unique', but keys which are not unique are made unique by prefixing them with the sample id.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
